snippet: The strikes were apparently aimed at the Haqqani network, a Taliban-allied faction that until last month held the American soldier Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl hostage.
abstract: American drone strikes militant compound in Pakistan's tribal belt for second time in 12 hours, killing at least 10 suspected members of Haqqani network in suddenly intense resurgences of Central Intelligence Agency offensive in Pakistan.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and ISMAIL KHAN
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh reported from London, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan. Salman Masood contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The strikes were apparently aimed at the Haqqani network, a Taliban-allied faction that until last month held the American soldier Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl hostage.

headline.main: U.S. Drone Hits Pakistan for 2nd Time in 12 Hours
headline.print_headline: U.S. Drone Hits Pakistan for 2nd Time in 12 Hours
